creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
When running under JDK 1.4.1 beta, I get messages like the following. Otherwise
everything seems to work correctly:

02/08/2002 12:39:50 java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences$3 run
WARNING: Could not create system preferences directory. System preferences are
unusable.
Running the test!
Thread Thread Group-1 started
Thread Thread Group-2 started
Thread Thread Group-3 started
Thread Thread Group-4 started
Thread Thread Group-5 started
Thread Thread Group-6 started
Thread Thread Group-7 started
Thread Thread Group-8 started
Thread Thread Group-9 started
Thread Thread Group-10 started
02/08/2002 12:40:22 java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences checkLockFile0ErrorCode
WARNING: Could not lock System prefs.Unix error code 135372840.
02/08/2002 12:40:22 java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences syncWorld
WARNING: Couldn't flush system prefs: java.util.prefs.BackingStoreException:
Couldn't get file lock.
02/08/2002 12:40:52 java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences checkLockFile0ErrorCode
WARNING: Could not lock System prefs.Unix error code 135372840.
02/08/2002 12:40:52 java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences syncWorld
WARNING: Couldn't flush system prefs: java.util.prefs.BackingStoreException:
Couldn't get file lock.
02/08/2002 12:41:22 java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences checkLockFile0ErrorCode
WARNING: Could not lock System prefs.Unix error code 135372840.
02/08/2002 12:41:22 java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences syncWorld
WARNING: Couldn't flush system prefs: java.util.prefs.BackingStoreException:
Couldn't get file lock.
02/08/2002 12:41:52 java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences checkLockFile0ErrorCode
WARNING: Could not lock System prefs.Unix error code 135372840.
02/08/2002 12:41:52 java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences syncWorld
WARNING: Couldn't flush system prefs: java.util.prefs.BackingStoreException:
Couldn't get file lock.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
This is a JVM issue, not a JMeter one.

To get rid of these messages, you just need to run JMeter as root once (no need
to do anything, just start it up). It will display the following message:

INFO: Created system preferences directory in /etc/.java/.systemPrefs

You can now stop JMeter. You'll never get these errors again.

Closing this as INVALID.
